title:
Fully Polarizable Multiconfigurational Self-consistent Field/Fluctuating
  Charge Approach
authors:
Chiara Sepali, Linda Goletto, Piero Lafiosca, Matteo Rinaldi, Tommaso
  Giovannini, Chiara Cappelli
abstract:
A multiscale model based on the coupling of the multiconfigurational
self-consistent field (MCSCF) method and the classical atomistic polarizable
Fluctuating Charges (FQ) force field is presented. The resulting MCSCF/FQ
approach is validated by exploiting the CASSCF scheme through application to
compute vertical excitation energies of formaldehyde and para-nitroaniline in
aqueous solution. The procedure is integrated with molecular dynamics
simulations to capture the solute's conformational changes and the dynamic
aspects of solvation. Comparative analysis with alternative solvent models,
gas-phase calculations, and experimental data provides insights into the
model's accuracy in reproducing solute-solvent molecular interactions and
spectral signals.
